title: NACC Uniform Data Set (UDS) - INITIAL VISIT PACKETForm C2: Neuropsychological BatterScores
description:
INSTRUCTIONS: This form is to be completed by ADC or clinic staff. For test administration and scoring, see 
Instructions for Neuropsychological Battery Form C2. Link to C2 Instructions . Any new subjects who enroll in 
the UDS after the implementation of UDS3 must be assessed with the new neuropsychological test battery (Form 
C2).
KEY: If the subject cannot complete any of the following exams, please give the reason by entering one of the 
following codes:
95/995=Physical problem
96/996=Cognitive/behavior problem
97/997=Other problem
98/998=Verbal refusal

mocacomp.title: 1a. Was any part of the MoCA administered?
enum:
0 No (If No, enter reason code, 95-98) below in
Question 1a1 and (SKIP TO QUESTION 2a)

mocareas.title: 1a1. Was any part of MoCA administered?  If no, enter reason code, 95-98)

mocavis.title: 1d. Subject was unable to complete one or more sections due to visual impairment:

mocahear.title: 1e. Subject was unable to complete one or more sections due to hearing impairment:

mocatots.title: 1f. TOTAL RAW SCORE - UNCORRECTED (Not corrected for education or visual/hearing impairment)&nbsp
mocatots.description: ((0-30, 88))(Enter 88 if any of the following MoCA items were not administered:  1g-1l, 1n-1t, 1w-1bb)

alert_mocatots.title: WARNING - a value of 88 should be entered in the box above.  At least one of the following MoCA items was not administered: 1g-1l, 1n-1t, 1w-1bb.

admin_rema_btry.title: 2. ADMINISTRATION OF THE REMAINDER OF THE BATTERY

npsycloc_c2.title: 2a. The tests following the MoCA were administered:

npsylan_c2.title: 2b. Test following MoCA:  Language of test administration.

npsylanx_c2.title: 2b1. Other language of tests following the MoCA:

craftvrs.title: 3a. Total story units recalled, verbatim scoring
craftvrs.description: ( If test not completed, enter reason code, 95-98, and SKIP TO QUESTION 4a. )((0-44, 95-98))

crafturs.title: 3b. Total story units recalled, paraphrase scoring (0-25)

udsbentc.title: 4a. Total score for copy of Benson figure
udsbentc.description: (If test not completed, enter reason code, 95-98)((0-17, 95-98))

digforct.title: 5a. Number of correct trials
digforct.description: (If test not completed, enter reason code, 95-98, and SKIP TO QUESTION 6a.)((0-14, 95-98))

digbacct.title: 6a. Number of correct trials
digbacct.description: (If test not completed, enter reason code,95-98, and    SKIP TO QUESTION 7a.)((0-14, 95-98))

animals_c2.title: 7a.  Animals: Total number of animals named in 60 second
animals_c2.description: (If test not completed, enter reason code, 95-98)(0-77, 95-98)

veg_c2.title: 7b.  Vegetables: Total number of vegetables named in 60 second
veg_c2.description: (If test not completed, enter reason code, 95-98)(0-77, 95-98)

traila_c2.title: 8a. PART A: Total number of seconds to complete
traila_c2.description: (if not finished by 150 seconds, enter 150) (If test not completed, enter reason code, 995-998, and    SKIP TO QUESTION 8b.) (0-150, 995-998)

trailb_c2.title: 8b. PART B: Total number of seconds to complete
trailb_c2.description: (if not finished by 300 seconds, enter 300) (If test not completed, enter reason code, 995-998, and SKIP TO QUESTION 9a.) (0-300, 995-998)

craftdvr.title: 9a. Total story units recalled, verbatim scoring
craftdvr.description: ( If test not completed, enter reason code, 95-98, and    SKIP TO QUESTION 10a. )

craftdre.title: 9b. Total story units recalled, paraphrase scoring (0-25)

udsbentd.title: 10a. Total score for drawing of Benson figure following 10- to 15-minute delay
udsbentd.description: (If test not completed, enter reason code, 95-98) and    SKIP TO QUESTION 11a.) ((0-17, 95-98))

udsbenrs.title: 10b. Recognized original stimulus from among four options?

minttots.title: 11a. Total score
minttots.description: (If test not completed, enter reason code, 95-98) and    SKIP TO QUESTION 12a.)

mintscnc.title: 11d. Semantic cues: Number correct with cue  (88=not applicable)

mintpcnc.title: 11f. Phonemic cues: Number correct with cue  (88=not applicable)

udsverfc.title: 12a. Number of correct F-words generated in 1 minute
udsverfc.description: (If test not completed, enter reason code, 95-98) and SKIP TO QUESTION 12d.) (0-40, 95-98)

udsverfn.title: 12b. Number of  F-words  repeated in 1 minute

udsvernf.title: 12c. Number of  F-words  and rule violation errors in 1 minute

udsverlc.title: 12d. Number of correct L-words generated in 1 minute
udsverlc.description: (If test not completed, enter reason code, 95-98) and    SKIP TO QUESTION 13a.) (0-40, 95-98)

udsverlr.title: 12e. Number of  L-words  repeated in 1 minute

udsverln.title: 12f. Number of  non-L-words  and rule violation errors in 1 minute

udsvertn.title: 12g. TOTAL number of correct  F-words and L-words

udsverte.title: 12h. TOTAL number of  F-words and L-words  repetition errors

udsverti.title: 12i. TOTAL number of  non-F/L words  and rule violation errors

cogstat_c2.title: 13a. Per the clinician (e.g., neuropsychologist, behavioral neurologist, or other suitably qualified clinician), based on the UDS Neuropsychological examination, the subject's cognitive status is deemed:
enum: 3 One or two test scores are abnormal
4 Three or more scores are abnormal or lower than expected
